reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have a yearly post Christmas tradition of spending a couple nights at one of the Vintage hotel properties in Niagara on the Lake. In the past it has always been the Pillar and Post or The Prince of Wales but this year our budget was a bit more limited so we decided to give the Vintage boutique property a try...and it was a very pleasant surprise! From the moment we arrived we felt like welcome and appreciated guests. Athena at the front desk is friendly, helpful and a fantastic Vintage property representative....a gem to speak to and also very informative on restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.text: Our room was a Deluxe on the second floor, room 132 to be exact. It was roomier than expected after reading reviews prior to our arrival. The only things we found missing from any other Vintage property was bath robes in the room, room service, spa facilities and an on site bar/restaurant....there is a restaurant but it is closed in the winter. It is considered a budget hotel but honestly we didn't get that feel. We paid the same we would have for a motel type room in Niagara Falls!
reviews.title: Welcoming, cozy. Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As well, keep in mind that with stay, you have access to the facilities (restaurant, spa, pool, hotub) at the other Vintage properties in town and they are accessible by free shuttle just a few steps away.
reviews.title: First time to N-o-t-L

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly a great experience! No complaints.
reviews.title: Price Is Right for Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Moffat Inn the weekend of December 13-15 2013. Nicki, the receptionist, was welcoming and so very helpful. We were able to check in early. Our room was cozy (small) with a gas fireplace which was lovely. The room was tidy/clean. Bathroom was modern. Closet was very tiny. Due to bad weather we needed to book a second room for family and Nicki came to the rescue. So everything about the Moffatt inn was perfect for us. Price, location, staff and their advice and the uniqueness of this building built in the 1800s.
reviews.title: No cleaning standards at all!!
